alert.note: Alert for Bronx (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Bronx and Westchester. Particularly along the Bronx River. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 PM EDT, Flooding is ongoing due to recent rainfall. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yonkers, Mott Haven, East Tremont, Bronxville, Mount Vernon, Woodlawn, Tuckahoe and Fordham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
